column2: General Manager-Plant Operations ( Candidates must be from Automobile Sectors only ) , Good knowledge of toolroom, Electroplating, Molding operations , Electrical and electronics accessories. Role & responsibilities Can Plan, execute, monitor, control, and close out the project as per schedule. Can Deliver projects on time, within budget, and meet quality standards. Can Adopt new technologies, methodologies, and positive approach to enhance the project delivery, Reverse Engineering. P & L activities based on Technical & Commercial evaluation. Can discus with consultant, release of drawings and data required on site. Can discus with Equipment suppliers on any design change. Ca Align activities and projects with the broader strategic objectives of the organization in order to achieve the organization mission and thrive in a rapidly changing business environment.  Can establish a culture of project management excellence that empowers teams, delivers on commitments, and continually improves our processes and methodologies. Can Promote best practices, providing training and support, and continuously improving project management processes. Collaboration in crucial for project success. Can Form a collaborative culture where teams work together effectively to achieve project goals. Can review the progress of ongoing and upcoming projects based on target dates.  Can review and ensure all the deliverables are delivered on time.   Preferred candidate profile     Responsible for readiness of new manufacturing facilities / Processes for existing and new products within Quality, Cost & Time lines. Responsible for P & L activities. Discussion with suppliers on technical / commercial terms and conditions related to procurement of goods and services and vendor development. Higher values purchasing items are discussed with the vendors independently and after comparison the orders are finalised based on Technical & Commercial evaluation.  For logistic part, AMC given to the renowned transport companies after having discussions independently considering all four zones. Ensure that manufacturing strategies and processes are in place to meet business objectives and operational needs in terms of price, quality, and delivery targets and which enables the company to function and compete effectively in the market. Development and implementation of an Operational Excellence program (Best Practices) which ensured continuous improvement in operations. R & D  Any design change if applicable is discussed with the Vendors considering the manufacturing facilities available and accordingly its finalized and followed by production and quality department. Deploying various methodologies to analysis processes and recommending modification to minimize escalations, reduce rejections, improve operating Efficiency, control variability, cost and reduce cycle time. Identify and procure capital equipment, machine installation & commissioning in fixed time frame. Design and Develop programs to Train and Upgrade the skill sets of employees on Operational Excellence, Environment. Implement Procurement Strategies for Plant and Machinery from local/ overseas suppliers & vendors / contingency plans in accordance with production and manufacturing requirements. Strategic Capacity / CAPEX / OPEX planning for various business scenarios in terms of future products and volumes. Benchmarking, Optimizing, bringing efficiency targets based on company standards for existing and new projects. Can Ascertain the program deliverables for Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost and Morale by planning and systematic review mechanisms (Yearly targets for day-to-day operational requirements). Can Provide support for Root Cause Analysis of product quality related issues. Can identify solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance interfacing with all functions such as R&D, procurement, Supplier Management, Logistics, Facility Management, quality and so on to track, assess & report status of the project. Can Create business case, monitor the project timeline, CAPEX spends, ensure availability of budget. Can Monitor Preparation of RFQs, technical & commercial comparison of proposals, scope of supply, time plan. Can Ensure adherence of Safety and Ergonomics standards in all facility / Process implementation. Can Perform PFMEA exercises to identified & mitigated risks of poor quality & reliability. Can Manage Execution of New Projects & Technology Transfer - Work closely with New Projects Team & Current Manufacturing Team.

column2: The Senior Systems Analyst (Engineering & Manufacturing) works closely with business teams to understand and analyze how core business processes leverage and interact with the PDM/PLM, CAD, and downstream manufacturing systems (i e, ERP, MES, MPS, etc) and identifies key opportunities for improvement     This role will act as a liaison between business units and technical teams by capturing business requirements, functional requirements, and ROIs related to process optimization and system integration projects     Works end-to-end with end-users, developers, and stakeholders to ensure quality assurance (QA) and timely delivery of IT projects     Coordinates and manages regular upgrades, enhancements, project deployments, and maintenance of the Engineering and Manufacturing systems to ensure stability, business continuity, and compliance with IT controls               Responsibilities/Objectives           Supports and aligns efforts to meet business needs     Manages relationships and expectations by communicating regularly with stakeholders on project status and results     Stays current with business needs and strategies; utilizes formal and informal written communication methods (i.e. emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists) to communicate updates and findings related to business processes and/or systems; facilitates project meetings and presentations to diverse audiences (i.e. senior management, end-users, technical staff)     Completes and regularly updates project documentation; manages project scope; adjusts project schedules when necessary; determines daily priorities; ensures efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; follows proper escalation paths; and manages relationships with stakeholders     Identifies, creates, and facilitates process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focuses on quality improvement and data management; ensures data is reliable, valid, and secure; develops process improvement plans; integrates new systems/processes with legacy systems/processes; and partners with business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions provided by IT align with long-term business strategies.     Provides and supports the implementation of technology-driven business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifies business needs; determines and carries out necessary processes and practices; monitors progress and results; recognizes and capitalizes on improvement opportunities; and adapts to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities     Provides project-level analysis and develops related diagrams, flows, tables, and/or graphs.     Collaborates closely with the Engineering and Manufacturing teams to implement solutions that align with business needs/requirements and support end-users and/or testers during the QA process.     Identifies business process improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)     Elicits and documents business and systems requirements (i.e., business requirements/stories, scope, use cases, diagrams)     Assesses PDM/PLM processes and related systems used by end-user groups and identify inefficiencies in system configuration, presentation, and overall UX (User Experience)     Demonstrates fluency in business processes and process differentiation     Understands and negotiates needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders     Creates and maintains issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates     Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions, and resolving conflicts.     Develops and executes test plans     Supports system conversions, upgrades, and enhancements.           Requirements           Must have experience working on multiple projects simultaneously while handling day-to-day intake of requests/issues/defects from the business     Strong project management skills; ability to successfully manage multiple tasks or competing priorities; strong relationship building skills & ability to negotiate     Bachelor s degree (IT or Computer Science focus preferred)     Engineering     5+ years of proven experience as a business/systems analyst and/or systems development capacity     5+ years of proven experience working with a professional PDM/PLM platform as a user, developer, analyst, or system administrator.     5+ years of CAD experience (ThingWorx, Creo, etc.)     10+ years in a technology-focused or process-improvement role     Basic understanding of relational database concepts and APIs     Proven analytical abilities     Exceptional interpersonal skills     Excellent written and verbal communication skills     Attention to detail

column2: US MNC : Manufacturing Process Engineer @ Mumbai  Our client offers miniature motor technologies to solve the motion needs of a spectrum of end markets, from medical devices to various industrial applications that save, improve, & enhance lives. We serve our customers through breadth of innovative product technologies to optimize application performance. They are part of the Large US Group , which is a leading, global manufacturer of airflow, motion control, power transmission & power generation solutions used in commercial, industrial, & residential settings. Current headcount exceeds 29,000 associates  Department   :  Manufacturing  Reports to:  Advance Manufacturing Manager  Position Summary:  Handled turnkey projects start from Laying the  Layout ,  Set-Up Of Equipment's  &  Productionize  to hand over.  Responsible for the delivery of  Advanced Engineered Solutions  by developing  Jigs & Fixture, Low-Cost Automation  & working on  Continuous Improvement Tools  for improving the Safety, Quality, Cost & Productivity using  Lean Tools & Six Sigma  tools.  Identify the supplier, estimate the cost & make the Techno commercial proposal to management for approval.  Responsible for  trialing out  the process with proper qualification & by updating the process documentation (like SOP, Setting procedure, etc.)  Will collaborate with stakeholders such as manufacturing, maintenance & quality for smooth Handover by providing training.  Monitor & reporting monthly/Quarterly/Half yearly to finance regarding overall  CAPEX (Budget Vs Actual).   Implementation of  Ind 4.0  regarding  M2M connectivity  using  IoT  & Integrate with Software to Provide a  Digital platform  for Manufacturing.  Education & Experience:  Bachelors Degree in Mechanical/ Production /Mechatronics/ Electrical Engineering with 4+ years of work experience  Essential Duties & Responsibilities:  Responsible for working with Stakeholder for understanding the requirement for developing a  new equipment Set-up  a  New Line Upgrading  of existing line/Equipment.  Responsible for understanding  Customer Requirement  & translate into  Technical Specification  by considering the product & Process characteristic, Safety, ergonomics, Poka-yoke & others etc.,  Create & development concept drawing of making  New Assembly Lines / Special Purpose Machines / Jigs & Fixtures- Tooling & Other Test  benches development.  Responsible for discussing the concept with stakeholders, getting mutual understanding & getting initial buy for making the proposal.  Responsible for implementing  Manufacturing Flow Charts, Standard Work, procedures, Control Plans & FMEAs  as prescribed by  ISO  standards & Business system. (For New Line/Existing line)  Responsible for Sending an enquiry to different supplier to get quotes, make the techno commercial comparison &  evaluate  in terms of  Function, Performance & Cost aspects.   Responsible for Raising the Capex by making the  Budgetary Proposal  along with justification for Management approval.  Co-ordinate & ensure for release Purchase order to supplier on time.  Responsible for  qualification of the tools equipment  or  Line / Layout mapping  etc. at both suppliers' end plant end as well.  Responsible for Making documentation such as SOP | WI | Manuals etc.  Responsible for providing training to the operator & other stakeholders from Manufacturing / Maintenance / Quality.  Responsible for Troubleshooting in Process Equipment & tools by using the  Problem-Solving  techniques.  Responsible & ensure to make a report regarding the Performance of the  Process Equipment Tools | Assembly Line  etc. in terms of  OEE  Responsible to hand over & sign off process equipment Tools , Assembly line to concern stakeholder for the smooth transition from Projects to Manufacturing.  Experience working in a team environment under time & resource pressures.  Responsible in Mapping  Ind 4.0  requirement for connecting  Machine to Machine  using  IoT device  & Integrate with Equipment  Weekly & Monthly report out of Project status  Functional Competencies:  Ability to conceptualize, design & develop  SPM  with  Low-Cost Automation.   Ability to conceptualize, design & development of efficient  Jigs, Fixtures  preferably with automation as feasible (  Assembly tools | Spot   Welding / Laser welding  etc)  Thorough understanding of  GD&T, Tolerance stack-up , Engineering Material properties,  DFM  concepts,  Ergonomics & Poka-Yokes  while proposing any change in the manufacturing set-up as well as designing new manufacturing lines. Hands on experience of  Process planning, Execution, Line balancing, Capacity Planning & Production Ramp - by using  Gnatt Chart/MS Projects   Hands on experience in  Welding Technology  like  Resistance | Plasma | Laser , in terms of  electrode selection, parameter setting  & optimization.  Hands on experience in design of  Pneumatic Circuits  & selecting of Pneumatic products based on the application. etc.  Exposure on  PLC  like defining  I/Ps & O/Ps & Sequence.   Hands on experience in selecting the  PLC , develop programming & execute the program with the application (Added Advantage)  Exposure in problems solving technique such as by implementing  SPC, poka-yoke  & other problem-solving tools (e.g.  Six Sigma )  Hands on experience on making Part drawings| Assembly drawing| details drawing using software such as  AutoCAD|3D  Modelling such as Solid works/Creo .etc Knowledge & experience working on MS Office & MS Projects.  Knowledge & Experience working on  Ind. 4.0   Software Experience:  3D Modeling software - Creo SolidWorks.  2D Drafting AutoCAD.  Pneumatic Design of Pneumatic Circuit in Fluid draw, SMC pneudraw etc.  PLC  Ladder Diagram  Mitusubshi, OMRON, Delta etc.  Lean Tools- Line Balancing, VSM, SMED & OEE etc.  Six Sigma tools- (Preferred Knowledge on DOE, Anova, Process Capability, Gage R &R)  MS- Projects- Project Management  MS-Office Skills : Word, Excel, & PowerPoint  Key Relationships:  Internal:  Manufacturing, Quality, R&D, Purchase, PT2 team ,  Direct labor  External:  Tooling suppliers  Personal Trait/Profile:  Ability to apply engineering & scientific principles & disciplines like Problem Analysis & Root  Cause Corrective Action; Statistical Process Control; Design of Experiments; Process Validation,  Facilities Layout & Process Design. column2: Job Description: As a Chemical Engineer, you will play a crucial role in our engineering team, responsible for preparing accurate cost estimates and project quotes for customer projects involving pressure reactors. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and commercial acumen to ensure competitive pricing and successful project execution. Responsibilities : Cost Estimation: Analyze project requirements, to develop detailed cost estimates for customer projects involving pressure reactors. Quoting: Prepare comprehensive project quotes based on cost estimates, pricing strategies, and customer specifications, ensuring alignment with company objectives and profitability targets. Technical Analysis: Evaluate technical specifications and engineering drawings to understand project scope, identify potential risks or challenges, and propose appropriate solutions to meet customer requirements. Proposal Development: Prepare professional proposals and presentations for customer projects, outlining scope of work, deliverables, timelines, and pricing details in a clear and concise manner. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of cost estimates, quotes, and project documentation, tracking project progress and profitability metrics for performance analysis and continuous improvement. Requirements : Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a focus on project management or cost estimation coursework preferred. Strong technical understanding of pressure reactor systems and chemical engineering processes, with the ability to interpret engineering drawings and specifications. Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy in estimating project costs and pricing strategies. Commercial awareness and business acumen, with the ability to balance customer needs, competitive pricing, and profitability objectives in project quoting and pricing decisions.
column11: Technical Analysis, Cost Estimation, Documentation and Reporting

Strong project management skills and attention to detail while meeting tight deadlines.      Excellent excellent verbal and written communication skills problem-solving abilities.      Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.      Proficiency in Qvidian or similar RFP content database management      Experience with Seismic desirable.      The ability to work collaboratively in a team setting      Have strong research skills using a variety of electronic systems and tools, both proprietary and third-party              Responsibilities          Produce high-quality first drafts of RFP and due diligence questionnaires (DDQ); writing/editing answers, gathering data from multiple sources (not all centralized), and working closely with a variety of teams. Core Values            Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and collaboration skills with all levels of management          Strong organizational skills including the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet frequent deadlines,          Demonstrated proactive approach to problem-solving with strong judgment and decision-making capability.          Highly resourceful and collaborative team-player, with the ability to also be independently effective and exude initiative and a sense of urgency.          Exemplifies our customer-focused, action-oriented, results-driven culture.          Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities, has a desire for continuous learning, and proposes solutions. column2: The Senior Systems Analyst (Engineering & Manufacturing) works closely with business teams to understand and analyze how core business processes leverage and interact with the PDM/PLM, CAD, and downstream manufacturing systems (i.e., ERP, MES, MPS, etc.) and identifies key opportunities for improvement. This role will act as a liaison between business units and technical teams by capturing business requirements, functional requirements, and ROIs related to process optimization and system integration projects. Coordinates and manages regular upgrades, enhancements, project deployments, and maintenance of the Engineering and Manufacturing systems to ensure stability, business continuity, and compliance with IT controls.              ?         Responsibilities/Objectives           Supports and aligns efforts to meet business needs     Manages relationships and expectations by communicating regularly with stakeholders on project status and results     Stays current with business needs and strategies; utilizes formal and informal written communication methods (i.e. emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists) to communicate updates and findings related to business processes and/or systems; facilitates project meetings and presentations to diverse audiences (i.e. senior management, end-users, technical staff)     Completes and regularly updates project documentation; manages project scope; adjusts project schedules when necessary; determines daily priorities; ensures efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; follows proper escalation paths; and manages relationships with stakeholders     Identifies, creates, and facilitates process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focuses on quality improvement and data management; ensures data is reliable, valid, and secure; develops process improvement plans; integrates new systems/processes with legacy systems/processes; and partners with business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions provided by IT align with long-term business strategies.     Provides and supports the implementation of technology-driven business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifies business needs; determines and carries out necessary processes and practices; monitors progress and results; recognizes and capitalizes on improvement opportunities; and adapts to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities     Provides project-level analysis and develops related diagrams, flows, tables, and/or graphs.     Collaborates closely with the Engineering and Manufacturing teams to implement solutions that align with business needs/requirements and support end-users and/or testers during the QA process.     Identifies business process improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)     Elicits and documents business and systems requirements (i.e., business requirements/stories, scope, use cases, diagrams)     Assesses PDM/PLM processes and related systems used by end-user groups and identify inefficiencies in system configuration, presentation, and overall UX (User Experience)     Demonstrates fluency in business processes and process differentiation     Understands and negotiates needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders     Creates and maintains issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates     Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions, and resolving conflicts.     Develops and executes test plans     Supports system conversions, upgrades, and enhancements.           Requirements           Must have experience working on multiple projects simultaneously while handling day-to-day intake of requests/issues/defects from the business     Strong project management skills; ability to successfully manage multiple tasks or competing priorities; strong relationship building skills & ability to negotiate     Bachelor s degree (IT or Computer Science focus preferred)     Engineering     5+ years of proven experience as a business/systems analyst and/or systems development capacity     5+ years of proven experience working with a professional PDM/PLM platform as a user, developer, analyst, or system administrator.     5+ years of CAD experience (ThingWorx, Creo, etc.)     10+ years in a technology-focused or process-improvement role     Basic understanding of relational database concepts and APIs     Proven analytical abilities     Exceptional interpersonal skills     Excellent written and verbal communication skills     Attention to detail

column2: Vanya Industrial Equipments is looking for Production Executives to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    A Production Executive plays a crucial role in overseeing and managing the production process within a company.      The specific responsibilities may vary depending on the industry, but here is a general job description for a Production Executive:      Planning and Coordination:Develop production plans and schedules to meet organizational goals and customer demand.Coordinate with different departments such as procurement, quality control, and logistics to ensure smooth production processes.      Budget Management:Manage and optimize the production budget to ensure cost-effectiveness.Identify areas for cost reduction and implement strategies to improve efficiency.      Quality Control:Implement and maintain quality control measures to ensure products meet specified standards.Collaborate with the quality assurance team to address any issues related to product quality.      Team Management:Supervise and lead a team of production staff.Train and mentor production personnel to enhance their skills and performance.Foster a positive and collaborative work environment.      Resource Allocation:Allocate resources effectively to meet production targets.Monitor and manage raw material inventory and production equipment.      Process Improvement:Identify areas for process improvement and implement changes to enhance efficiency.Stay updated on industry best practices and technological advancements to improve production processes.      Health and Safety Compliance:Ensure that all production activities comply with health and safety regulations.Implement safety protocols to minimize workplace accidents and incidents.      Communication:Communicate effectively with other departments, such as sales, marketing, and supply chain, to align production with overall business objectives.Report regularly to senior management on production progress, challenges, and achievements.      Problem-solving:Address and resolve production issues in a timely and efficient manner.Analyze root causes of problems and implement corrective actions.      Continuous Monitoring:Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess production performance.Implement measures to improve productivity and reduce downtime.      Compliance:Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.Keep abreast of changes in regulations and adjust production processes accordingly.      Project Management:Oversee specific projects within the production process, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.
column11: Procurement, Supply chain, Product quality, Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Process improvement, Cost reduction, Manager Quality Control, Raw material, Logistics

Equipment Selection and Maintenance: Selecting appropriate machinery and equipment for production processes and ensuring their proper maintenance to minimize downtime and maximize productivity. Quality Control and Assurance: Implementing quality control measures to monitor and maintain product quality throughout the manufacturing process, including inspection, testing, and adherence to industry standards. Resource Management: Managing resources such as raw materials, labor, and energy efficiently to minimize waste and reduce production costs. Production Scheduling: Developing production schedules and coordinating with other departments to ensure timely delivery of products to customers while optimizing resource utilization. Troubleshooting and Problem-Solving: Identifying and resolving production-related issues, such as equipment malfunctions, process inefficiencies, and quality defects, in a timely manner to minimize disruptions. Safety Compliance: Ensuring compliance with safety regulations and promoting a culture of safety in the workplace to prevent accidents and injuries. Documentation and Reporting: Maintaining accurate records of production activities, including production data, quality reports, and maintenance logs, and generating reports for management review. Stakeholder Communication Communicate effectively with other department heads, executive management, and external stakeholders. column2: Job Summary:   Operates machines and production equipment in accordance with quality and productivity requirements safely in a manufacturing environment with limited guidance. Raises issues to minimize cost and quality exposures. Performs quality inspections. Identifies and controls non-conforming material. Maintains clean and orderly work area, including routine housekeeping tasks and machine cleaning tasks and performs planned operator care and maintenance tasks. Remains flexible and performs other miscellaneous duties, as required, to meet production goals. Works with peers, skilled trades and support staff to maintain and identify equipment needing repair. Participates actively in ways to improve quality, safety, process, material flow, and employee development. column1: Lead Sourcing Specialist - Supplier Quality Assurance
column2: As a Lead Supplier Quality Engineer, you will take ownership for quality and continuous improvement across a range of suppliers.      You will build relationships with internal teams, suppliers to ensure successful delivery .      You will ensure supplier quality to global standards and lead continuous improvement where there are performance issues.                As a Lead Sourcing Specialist - Supplier Quality Assurance, you will be responsible for:        Being responsible for Supporting Supplier Quality Assurance for Engineering system & Fabrication category aligned with the India Sourcing regional growth.      Being responsible for Supplier Quality Performance improvement for Engineering system & Fabrication category from FPQ s till execution of serial production orders.      Managing onboarding of new supplier, recommends improvements utilizing Supplier Scorecards and ensuring supplier compliance.      Using Quality tools to identify the risk and define effective mitigation plan to flawless execution.      Leading robust root cause analysis & Using DMAIC methodology / APOLLO RCA to identify & eliminate.      Conducting audits (Process, Product, Quality systems, SSRP/Compliance, Eyes always Open).      Being an Expert for Quality, Manufacturing, Engineering organizations to improve Quality and Manufacturing processes at supplier end.      Mentoring the Suppliers to deliver the products on time with full compliance.      Being responsible for key metrics defined for Quality, Delivery, Cost of Quality, RCA effectiveness.      Developing positive relationships with all stakeholders to manage and implement Engineering changes, New Product Introductions (NPIs).          Fuel your passion        To be successful in this role you will:        Have a graduate in Mechanical engineering with    12+ years experience in Quality, Manufacturing, Vendor related functions.        Have Green Belt, Black belt (    Preferred    ) and ability to travel locally and internationally.      Have an ability to demonstrate good EHS background, familiar with Indis Environmental, health, and safety law and regulations.      Have an expertise in International Standards & Regulatory Requirements with specifications (ASTM, PED, IEC, ANSI, CE, CSA, UL, DIN)      Have a sound    understanding of Fabrication processes, P&ID, special processes like painting, welding, NDE etc    .      Have well versed in    understanding drawings, Geometrical Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T), manufacturing process plan (MPP), conducting FMEA    s.      Have a Knowledge in welding & NDT ( good to have) and Ssound understanding of Pressure vessels, fluid systems & Structural items etc.      Be able to understand and establish appropriate inspection/measurement system based on the technical specification and functional characteristics.      Have good project management skills to handle multiple projects and good collaboration skills to connect with internal & external customers?      Have good decision-making skills to various project issues/challenges and good at multi-tasking to meet business expectations.

column2: Manpower Resources India Pvt. Ltd., a leading Executive Search & Selection Company offers services to Manufacturing, Engineering, Infrastructure & Healthcare domain. We have been mandated by a large conglomerate into Paint Business for the below mentioned role & we found your skill sets & credentials are quite aligned. We would like to discuss further to assess your suitability as per your convenience. Position title:  Head - Paint Project Location:  Bhubaneswar Experience:  15+ years  Qualification:  BE/B.tech /BSc/Diploma  Job Purpose: As the HOD for Greenfield Paint Project, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the establishment and operation of a new paint manufacturing facility from inception to full-scale production. Your responsibilities will encompass project management, team leadership, operational planning, and strategic decision-making to ensure the successful launch and sustained excellence of the project. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution:  Lead the planning, design, and execution phases of the Greenfield Paint Project(Water based & Solvent based Paint). Collaborate with cross-functional teams including engineering, procurement, construction, and regulatory compliance to ensure project milestones are met within budget and timelines. Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resource plans. Leadership: Establish operational protocols and procedures for the manufacturing facility in alignment with industry best practices and regulatory standards. Recruit, train, and manage a team of skilled professionals across various functions including production, quality control, maintenance, and logistics. Foster a culture of safety, innovation, and continuous improvement within the project team. Quality Assurance and Compliance: Implement robust quality assurance programs to uphold product quality and consistency. Ensure compliance with all relevant environmental, health, and safety regulations. Conduct regular audits and inspections to maintain adherence to quality and regulatory standards. Supply Chain Management: Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors to secure necessary raw materials and resources for production. Optimize inventory management processes to minimize waste and ensure adequate stock levels. Identify opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency improvements within the supply chain. Required Attributes: Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams. Proven experience in project management, preferably in the paint manufacturing industry, with a track record of successfully delivering large-scale projects on time and within budget. Must have experience in Water based & Solvent based Paint. In-depth knowledge of manufacturing processes, quality control systems, and regulatory requirements related to paint production. Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in project management tools and software. Experience in greenfield project management is highly desirable.

column2: Job   Purpose (Significance of the role & Objectives)   As a Manufacturing Manager, your primary objective is to ensure   optimal equipment performance, safety in operations, meeting production   targets, and maintaining high-quality standards. Your role is pivotal in   ensuring the efficient functioning of production lines to meet customer   demands. Essential skills include expertise in tool design and fabrication   methods, along with proficiency in project management, commitment to quality   assurance, and adherence to safety and environmental standards. Establish safe production environments and set up machines for optimal performance. Conduct capacity planning, line balancing, time studies, and cycle time analyses to enhance productivity and reduce costs. Drive improvements in productivity and cost reduction initiatives. Develop new jigs and fixtures to enhance production efficiency. Manage workflow for production projects, ensuring efficiency throughout the process. Oversee quality assurance processes to ensure products meet specified standards. Analyze production data to  optimize efficiency and identify areas for improvement. Strategically layout equipment and material flow to enhance operational efficiency. Ensure compliance with   performance and safety requirements for both workers and equipment. Proactively identify and address operational challenges, seeking continuous improvement opportunities. Recruit, train, and evaluate staff performance, while delegating tasks effectively.     Desired   Qualifications: Required Qualification, Knowledge, and Experience   Bachelors or master?? degree in mechanical, Automobile, or Industrial Engineering. 8-12 years of relevant  experience, preferably in manufacturing roles. Advanced knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) and tolerance stack-up   analysis. Familiarity with quality  metrics, APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA, QMS, and 8D methodologies. Excellent communication, organizational, and team-building skills. Demonstrated leadership abilities with a track record of managing cross-functional teams. Technical proficiency in manufacturing-related tools such as technical drawings, blueprints, CAD/CAM  software. Proficiency in Microsoft  Excel and other relevant industry software. Bachelor?? degree in electrical engineering would be a plus.   Key Competencies   Result oriented/Goal   driven. Proficiency in oral and   written communication. Self-motivated, passionate   about learning, and takes initiative with a problem-solving attitude. column2: This is a strategic leadership position as a Factory head of a flexible packaging manufacturing facility. The position is responsible for Planning, Production, Process Improvements, Quality Management, Maintenance, Warehouse, Customer Service and Employee Relations for entire site. In addition, this position manages the relationships between the plants, sales, vendors and all activities related to Operations.  A high level of focus on efficiency and cost management while driving manufacturing excellence with active people development and creating a healthy and harmonious work atmosphere, active product and process development and efficient project management are some of key attributes. Manufacturing project types include Continuous Improvement, process development, talent development, business system development, quality system improvements and implementation of Lean Manufacturing Techniques.  The purpose of this role is to lead and coordinate all aspects of the manufacturing unit and ensure production targets are met with delivery of the right quantity and quality of products as per defined targets in a cost effective manner.    Production & Performance Target Achievement:  Develop, implement and oversee manufacturing plans and strategies including capacity planning regarding equipment, training, staffing, raw materials, packaging, systems, and general operations improvements.  Balance       work capacity across the plants. Lead       debottlenecking projects to improve productivity and add production       capacity. Evaluate       new product concepts for manufacturing capabilities.  Identifies,       communicates and drives implementation of capital investments and       improvement projects Safety : Continue improvements in safety record and increase ownership of the safety program to the operator level.  Focus       to be placed on improving tracking and correcting of hazards / near       misses reducing overall hazard opportunities in the facility (Sharps /       Slips / Soft Tissue.  Ensuring 100% statutory compliance through regularly       monitoring the external environment for changes in the laws and       regulations and suggesting corrective action   Quality Target Achievement  Drive       excellence through ISO and other Quality Programs; build quality       orientation in all aspects of production operations. Focus to minimize       reject, rework  Continuously       challenge the status quo and refine the specifications  Identify       quality issues and generate and implement corrective actions  Cost Management:  Ensure compliance with Company standards for cost control, waste reduction, quality, health & safety, food safety, and complete on-time delivery at the lowest possible cost.  Review production       and operating reports and directs the resolution of operational,       manufacturing, and maintenance problems to ensure minimum costs and       prevent operational delays. Monitor,       report, and initiate action on results of efficiencies, quality, safety,       delivery and costs.  Identify       and implement cost savings initiatives.  Promote       and implement 80/20 simplification principles based on the Pareto theory. Employee Relations:  Oversee fair and consistent administration of policies, work rules, disciplinary actions, promotions, performance reviews, pay increases, skill development, and job performance counseling for reports. Manage all       personnel issues within the facilities, including such functions as       staffing, compensation, behavioral issues, termination, transfer and       promotions. Manage, coach, and develop talent. Create       strong relationships and work closely with all operations in sharing       knowledge, resources, technology, cost savings ideas, and product /       process improvements. Ensure       maximum productivity and satisfactory working with desired co-operation.       Take actions in any crisis or disciplinary issue  Responsible       for generating safety awareness, training employees on safe working       procedures and provision of safety equipment  Liaises       with all local authorities, bureaucrats and statutory authorities to       establish goodwill for the Co. leading to smoother functioning  Capability & Leadership Building:  Induct       high quality talent across all levels in the organization  Implement       a customer focused operational culture delivering world class customer       service levels.  Establish       a culture of Quality, safety, performance & cost consciousness in the       entire site. Creating a work culture in alignment with SVP Vision and       Values  Drive       capability building, talent management and succession planning for key       roles. Identify employees with good potential and groom them to take       higher responsibilities.  Provide       leadership to departments under control and coach, mentor and develop       direct reports and manage a high performing team that delivers continuous       improvement, added value and cost reductions  Drive       the Performance management process. Provide feedback to all team members       on time to time basis, so that there is continuous improvement in their       performance as well as behaviour  Manage       people resources for optimum staffing (avoid Overstaffing and maintain a       lean workforce)  Have       structured communication mediums and forums that would facilitate       knowledge and information sharing with team members  Identify       technical, functional and behavioural areas of development in the team       members, and send them for relevant trainings and continuously upskill       them to take up higher responsibility jobs  Work       closely with internal and external key stakeholders, regarding technical       support for activities, striving for best in class products and business       practices to deliver to the customers expectations  Train       the HODs and team to follow established SOPs accurately. Share problem-       solving strategies and encourage critical thinking in resolving technical       challenges.  Encourage       cross-training among team members to ensure flexibility and a well-       rounded skill set.  Develop       leadership skills among HODs allowing them to mentor junior team and       take on additional responsibilities. Perform other related duties as assigned.

column2: Role & responsibilities   The key objective of this role is to provide strategic leadership, direction, and oversight to both manufacturing and supply chain management functions thereby ensuring optimal efficiency, adherence to quality standards and alignment with organizational growth targets. By driving strategic planning, regulatory compliance, cost control, and fostering a work culture of innovation and employee development, this role will contribute to the overall growth and success of the company in the medical device industry.  Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor's or masters degree in engineering is preferred. Advanced certifications in manufacturing management or quality control are advantageous, with a minimum of 20-25 years of experience. Prior experience in medical devices, especially with intraocular lenses (IOLs) will be an added advantage. Proven experience in manufacturing operations within the pharmaceutical or medical device industry in regulated markets, demonstrating a strong track record of success in previous leadership positions is a clear expectation. This background equips the candidate with the expertise to navigate the complexities of the industry and drive operational excellence. In-depth knowledge of current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and other relevant regulatory standards is essential, for ensuring strict compliance and adherence to quality and safety requirements like US FDA, MHRA, ANVISA and other regulatory agencies. Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic plans, digitization initiatives (SAP  HANA), Trackwise, Documentum, etc., for seamless alignment of manufacturing goals with broader organizational objectives in driving the company's growth and competitiveness. Exceptional leadership and communication skills to effectively lead cross-functional teams, foster collaboration, and resolve conflicts cutting across functions and geographies. Proficiency in crisis management, showcasing the capability to make informed objective decisions under pressure and provide clear direction to teams. Strong budgeting and financial management skills, ensuring efficient resource allocation and achievement of financial targets. Collaborative mindset with the ability to align operational strategies with various organizational functions, facilitating cross-functional coordination in a dynamic business environment including interfaces with R&D on new product development and other facility expansion opportunities with project management. Oversee validation activities throughout the project lifecycle (Blow fill Seal), ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and driving continuous improvement initiatives.   Role Requirements:   Direct, administer, and coordinate internal operational activities in line with organizational policies, goals, and objectives. Participate in the development and promotion of short-term and long-range plans and budgets, recommending their adoption to management. Develop and establish operating policies consistent with management's broad objectives, ensuring their effective execution. Proactively identify potential risks and develop contingency plans to minimize disruptions in manufacturing operations and the supply of the company product profolio. Monitor manufacturing performance through key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports to senior management. Facilitate the resolution of interdepartmental issues, fostering a collaborative work environment. Take charge efficiently during high-priority crises, ensuring direct management of company operations to meet budgetary requirements and control the cost of goods sold (COGS). Develop short-term and long-term planning and budget development to support strategic business goals. Establish performance benchmarks, allocate resources, and assess policies for the Tier-2 team to achieve higher productivity and capacity utilization. Oversee capacity enhancement and growth initiatives aligning with business plans including interfaces with R&D on new product development and introduction into manufacturing, along with facility expansion efforts (Greenfield or Brownfield efforts) to support the future growth of the organization. Foster operational alignment with other functions, managing the inventory levels and stock out situation along with initiation of timely and appropriate CAPA execution to prevent recurrence of the incidents. Ensure production plans align with Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) targets, and invoice plans match commitments. Lead the supply chain, logistics, and procurement departments, collaborating with various teams to enhance operational efficiency and reliability. Guide the team to identify and mitigate risks in the supply chain, stay informed about global supply chain trends and geopolitical factors. Identify opportunities for technology adoption and process automation, collaborating with IT teams to implement digital solutions for supply chain optimization. Establish strategic partnerships with key suppliers and logistics providers to enhance operational efficiency and reliability. Functional Skills: Strategic Planning and Execution: Ability to develop and execute short-term and long-range plans aligned with organizational objectives and business goals. Budgeting and Financial Management: Proficient in developing and managing short-term and long-term budgets, ensuring adherence to financial targets and requirements. Operational Leadership: Demonstrated expertise in directing and administering internal operational activities to meet budgetary requirements and control the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS). Supply Chain Management: In-depth knowledge and experience in leading, supervising, and guiding the supply chain management, logistics, and procurement departments to optimize processes and achieve operational goals. Regulatory Compliance: Strong understanding of regulatory standards, especially Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), to ensure strict compliance and adherence to quality and safety requirements including US FDA & other regulatory bodies/customer audits requirements resulting in successful audit/client outcomes. Behavioral Skills Required: Crisis Management: Proven ability to take charge during high-priority crises efficiently, making well-informed decisions under pressure. Collaboration and Conflict Resolution: Exceptional skills in resolving interdepartmental issues through effective communication and collaboration, fostering a collaborative work environment. Leadership and Mentorship: Strong leadership qualities with the ability to lead, mentor, and foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the manufacturing and operational teams. Continuous Improvement: Commitment to continuous evaluation of manufacturing processes, exploring opportunities for automation and efficiency improvements. Strategic Partnership Building: Proficient in establishing strategic partnerships with key suppliers and logistics providers to enhance operational efficiency and reliability. Team Size to be Manage: Position reports to the CMD. Led a team of Manufacturing and Supply Chain Management, collaborating with aligned departments and overseeing direct reports from AGM to Senior Manager levels with a total team size of 600+ strength and up to 5 direct reports across multiple manufacturing sites in India and International. Biotech is an Equal Opportunity Organization promoting diversity while ensuring no discrimination on any ground including gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, etc.
column11: Process Management, Manufacturing Operations, Supply Chain Operations, Operations Management, Production Operations, Business Operations

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled Salesforce and SAP Specialist to join our manufacturing team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Salesforce and SAP platforms, with a focus on implementing and optimizing these systems to streamline operations and enhance productivity in a manufacturing environment. As a Salesforce and SAP Specialist, you will play a critical role in managing the integration, customization, and continuous improvement of these platforms to meet the unique needs of our manufacturing processes. Responsibilities: Salesforce Implementation:  Lead the implementation of Salesforce CRM system tailored to the requirements of the manufacturing industry, including modules for sales, customer service, and marketing. SAP Integration:  Integrate SAP ERP system with Salesforce CRM to ensure seamless data flow and synchronization between sales, production, inventory, and finance modules. Customization and Configuration:  Customize Salesforce and SAP modules to meet the specific needs of manufacturing processes, including workflows, data fields, and reporting functionalities. Process Optimization:  Analyze existing manufacturing processes and identify opportunities for optimization using Salesforce and SAP capabilities, such as automation, workflow management, and predictive analytics. Data Management:  Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity within Salesforce and SAP systems through regular maintenance, data cleansing, and validation rules. User Training and Support:  Provide training and support to manufacturing staff on Salesforce and SAP functionalities, ensuring effective utilization and adoption of these systems. Reporting and Analytics:  Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and analytics within Salesforce and SAP to track key performance indicators (KPIs), monitor production efficiency, and identify areas for improvement. Continuous Improvement:  Stay updated on the latest features and updates in Salesforce and SAP platforms, and proactively identify opportunities for system enhancements and process improvements. Cross-functional Collaboration:  Collaborate with IT, operations, sales, and finance teams to align Salesforce and SAP implementations with overall business goals and requirements. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of X years of experience working with Salesforce and SAP systems in a manufacturing environment. Salesforce Administrator and SAP certifications are highly preferred. Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and operations, including production planning, inventory management, and supply chain logistics. Proficiency in Salesforce customization, configuration, and development (Apex, Visualforce) as well as SAP modules relevant to manufacturing (PP, MM, SD). Experience with data integration, migration, and synchronization between Salesforce and SAP systems. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION: We are looking to hire a skilled PLC programmer to design and install controller system software, You will be traveling to clients' locations, analysing system requirements, writing and installing custom programmable logic code, testing system efficiency, and providing operational support. column2: About Schneider Electric   Schneider Electric SE  is a French multinational company that specializes in digital automation and energy management. Schneider Electric is a publicly traded Fortune Global 500 company, the company posted revenues of 34.2 billion. It addresses homes, buildings, data centers, infrastructure and industries, by combining energy technologies, real-time automation, software, and services. Schneider Electric is the parent company of APC, Aveva, L&T E&A among so many. Electrical & Automation (E&A)  is a part of Schneider Electric, which has a presence across the globe. We believe people are the core of everything we do at Electrical & Automation. We are incredibly proud of our people practices, which are progressive, particularly our policies around growth, diversity, equity, and inclusion. The health & well-being of our employees is of the topmost priority for us. India is one of the 4 global hubs, which implies that the Indian business plays a key role in India and globally  for technology, innovation, and manufacturing for the company. It also provides a plethora of opportunities for all kinds of profiles in India with a major focus on digital transformation including roles such as data analytics, data science, digital services, AI, among others. Over the years our Company has been widely recognized such as - by Kincentric as the Best Employer; by Catalyst for our efforts in Diversity, Equity & Inclusion; by SHRM for our policies around well-being; and many more. Our Companys vision for sustainability aligns with Indias vision. We have been actively contributing to Indias growth story by supporting key government initiatives such as Make in India, Smart Cities, Startup India, and Atmanirbhar Bharat. Job Description:   Experience:  6-10 years Educational Qualification:  B.E./B.Tech (Electrical / Mechanical) Key role and responsibilities: 1. Design & Development in MCCB Basic group 2. Life cycle management of MCCB 3. Analysis : Structural, Thermal, dynamic, and kinematic analysis using FEA  4. Experience on cost reduction/value engineering project 5. Resolution of issues related to product performance, application, and customer complaints. Functional Competencies: 1. 3D Modelling (Proe Creo), experience in Plastic and sheet metal 2. Design and development of switchgear products, Understanding of Electromechanical design. 3. Co-ordination with CFT 4. Understanding of Six Sigma tools, technical standards related to LV switchgear (IS/IEC ??60947-1 and IS/IEC ??60947-2 preferred) Behavioural Competencies   : 1. Good analytics skills, ability to get into details 2. Creative & Innovative 3. Team Work, working with diverse team 4. Ownership & Problem-solving Attitude. 5. Oral and written communication skills 6. Effectively handle multiple priorities   If interested and found this job suitable, then do apply through Schneider's career page

column1: Assistant Manager / Dy. Manager / Manager Design Process
column2: Position Name: Manager / Deputy Manager / Assistant Manager  Location : Dombivli Department / Function : Design and Projects  Sub Function : Project planning and co-ordination REPORTING STRUCTURE Reporting Manager : GM/DGM/AGM/Sr. Manager Direct Reportees : Three to five Process Engineers JOB PURPOSE Establishing clear understanding of customers needs and expectation and realisation of same with the help of concerned Group Leaders, and completion of project in given time. Area of Responsibility Responsibilities Understanding of Project  1. Co-ordination of project activities with various functional group leaders. Planning / Review of the progress of the project and implementing recovery plans. 2. Estimating the project budget with guidance from group leaders 3. Responsible for timely completion of the project within approved budget.  Basic Engineering 1. Review of SOP, material and energy balance prepared by process engineers. 2. Review of Equipment list, layout prepared by process engineers. 3. Review of PFD, P&ID prepared by process engineers. 4. Review of Process data sheets, Instrument process data sheets, Electrical drive list, Special material list, Service list prepared by process engineers. 5. Preparation of control logic and interlocks. 6. Review of calculations related to agitators, pumps, Heat exchangers etc. prepared by process engineers. Detail Engineering  1. Review of isometrics, civil scope received from piping team and suggesting the changes if needed. 2. Review of equipment drawings received from machinery group and suggesting the changes if needed. 3. Review of offers and drawings of packaged items like MEE, etc received from machinery group and suggesting the changes if needed.  Erection and commissioning at site  1. Co-ordination with mechanical and civil team for the erection activities. 2. Co-ordination with R&D and production team for pre commissioning and commissioning activities. 3. Arranging process & HAZOP study & implementing its recommendations. Handover  1. Submitting the documents related to equipments and plant related drawings like final layout and P&ID to production and maintenance team. KEY INTERACTIONS Internal - R&D and pilot plant, Site team(Mechanical and Civil), procurement team, Instrument team, Electrical team, Civil team, Environment team and piping and machinery team External - Vendors, Site Contractors, Consultants Geographical Scope (Global, Regional or Local) - Maharashtra (Dombivli & Lote, Ratnagiri) Gujarat - Ankleshwar, Sayakha, Panoli Minimum Education Qualification - Bachelor of Chemical Engineering / MTech Chemical? Certification - Process Engineering Course Minimum Experience (in Years) - 10 years

column2: Role & responsibilities     Strict adherence to safety, health and environment.   Carry out Manufacturing activities by following and monitoring standard   operating procedure (SOP) and current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP).   To ensure effective implementation of RFT and Data integrity policy.   Maintenance, upkeep of the department, premises, and equipment.   To maintain discipline in the section   To protect product and material against spillage and deterioration   Monitoring and Safely operating the machine as per SOP, with minimum   rejection & maximum output.   Improvement, continuous review and up gradation of existing SOPs &   work systems and to ensure their strict implementation.   To track execution of cleaning activity of non-product contact/indirect   product contact surfaces   Discussion of the day to day work with Section Head.   To Co-ordination with other   sections and departments.   Check and Monitor for cleanliness and environmental conditions of area   w.r.t. temperature, relative humidity, differential pressure, microbial   control, fly control and AHU handling (SCADA).   To ensure that all materials and finished products are stored under the   appropriate conditions as per specification and in an orderly fashion to   permit batch segregation and stock rotation.   To perform study as per various Study Protocol in areas.   To perform activities such as Cleaning, Line Clearance, Operation, PPM   and Calibration of equipment and area as per roles and responsibilities.   To cooperate for investigation of deviations, OOS, OOT and complaints   observed as per Standard Procedure.   To perform timely entries of data and completeness of Batch Manufacturing   Record, Checklist, Logs and Protocols on Isuued Documents.   To perform activities such as Calibration, Sanitization, Maintanance of Processing   and Non-Processing area.   Maintain and monitor inventory required in Department and Scrap the   damaged inventory.   To transfer Inprocess and Finished goods to Inprocess store.   Checking raw material is dispensed for manufacturing of batches and   Issuance of batches for processing of next stage and ensure Preparatory set   up work prior to start of manufacturing activity.    To monitor and maintain correct Status labelling of containers,   equipments, area and materials.   Identification, classification, finding, quarantine and destruction of   rejects generated during manufacturing process.    Calibration of equipment, instruments and weighing balances and PPM as   per schedule and maintaining records of the same.   To Operate SAP system, PRAMAAN (E-Log), LMS, and CIPDOX system based on   roles and rights Provided in the application.   To involve in the training conducted in the section (Scheduled training,   Training on changes, Miscellaneous) and as per the nominations given by   Section Head/ Department Head.   Participating in Process Validation and Cleaning Validation in   co-ordination with Quality Assurance.    Reconciliation   of Quantities at various stages of manufacturing.   To check   received work order and Dispensed batch from Store.   Online stage wise   review, compilation of batch manufacturing record and submission to   department head.   Installation,   operation and performance qualification of new machines and requalification   of existing machines as per defined frequency and to perform FMECA of machines   in manufacturing department.   Supervision and   duty allocation to Staff & workmen in the section.   Execute the   dispensing of raw material activity as per manufacturing plan Preferred candidate profile   Candidate with full time Diploma / B.Sc degree & minimum 1 year of experience in OSD Formulation
column11: OSD, Solid Orals, Formulation, Pharmaceutical

column2: Looking for a Process Head - at Odisha for a 150 KLPD Grain Based Plant who will be responsible for Milling, Liquefecation Fermentation, Evaporation Distillation, Decanter Dryer, ETP, and ISO Standards Exp : 15+ yrs B.SC with preference in PGDIFAT He should have experience in managing a large workforce and responsible for effective and efficient production management. Ensure compliance as per standards. Ensures the efficient utilization of production operations to produce high quality product within the prescribed standard operating procedures for safety, quality, cost, environmental, and compliance Ensures reliability and consistency of production, product quality, governmental compliance, employee safety, and environmental impact  Responsible to Plan direct and ensure controls for the entire process activities of the distilling operations right from Liquefaction, fermentation, Evaporation & Distillation. Responsible to send daily process report and chemical composition report to Unit head . Responsible to ensure that 20 various chemicals, water etc. are available for production. Oversee routine preventative maintenance on equipment and infrastructure in collaboration with distillery staff. Adheres to and advances a 'Safety Always' culture. Maintain a clean and stable work environment through CIP (Clean in Place) procedures and solid general housekeeping practices in collaboration with Distillery staff Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Knowledge and maintenance of ISO Standards Responsible for Innovation and continuous improvements. Perform related duties as assigned by supervisor.   Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:  B.SC with preference in PGDIFAT 15+ yrs of experience working in a Distillery industry and supervising distillation of ENA Knowledge across all facets of the ethanol process including: Milling, Liquefaction, Fermentation, Distillation, Evaporation, Decanter, Dryers Boiler, and water treatment, or part of is preferred. Experience of managing a large team Advanced critical thinking and troubleshooting skills. column1: Business Process Analyst (SAP Order To Cash)
column2: The Business Process Analyst Order to Cash (OTC) will be responsible for owning the design and maintenance of the E2E Order to Cash process flows for Delta Faucet Company Supply Chain Planning, Distribution, Service, and related site Operations space (manufacturing domain) on the SAP S/4HANA environment. This role works in shared partnership with project implementation teams and is accountable for sustainment of existing and new solutions implemented through the SAP landscape.   Business Process Analyst understands the variability of Customer/Consumer sales order entry points (Commerce Clouds/EDI/SAP), has deep expertise across the various sub-modules under SAP OTC (Business Partners /Customer Hierarchy/Business Validations/Pricing/Credit Checks/Fill Rate/Fulfillment/Invoicing), well-versed to diagnose and spec and execute configurable/customizable solutions that meet business functional requirements while adhering to DFC Information Services (IS) controls and compliance policies, sustaining the solution lifecycle through Change Advisory Board (CAB) hand offs. SAP OTC Analyst is also responsible to participate and support routine system maintenance procedures like quarterly refreshes, functional validation testing, periodic EDI Customer Onboarding specifications/configurations, day to day SAP operations, execute periodic SAP Upgrade relevant activities tasks and testing. They work mostly independently under the leadership/guidance of Supply Chain Service and Operations Solutions Manager partner alongside of Project Managers, other IS teams, and partners in Supply Chain to deliver innovative solutions, solve business problems with technology and process improvements that drive business results.   Primary Duties and Responsibilities-   Solutions Design Delivery & Support  ??Participate in execution/Transition from execution of E2E solution initiatives primarily on the core SAP S/4HANA landscape, while building high level understanding of integrating peripheral platforms like Sales/Service/Commerce (like Salesforce) to In-house/3PL (like Mahanttan WMi) Warehousing application process flows  ??Ensure developed/delivered solutions align with defined DFC architectural direction, IS standards/SOP/Playbooks and IT Controls compliance. column2: Objective-  We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Production Technician specializing in the manufacturing and repair of  CCTV cameras to join our team. The Production Technician will be responsible for the assembly, testing, troubleshooting, and repair of CCTV cameras to ensure they meet high-quality standards and customer requirements. The ideal candidate should have a strong technical background, hands-on experience with electronic devices, and a commitment to delivering excellent service to our clients. Key Responsibilities: Assemble CCTV cameras according to established manufacturing processes and technical specifications, ensuring accuracy and precision in all assembly tasks. Conduct comprehensive functional tests and quality inspections on newly assembled cameras to verify proper functionality and adherence to performance standards. Diagnose technical issues and malfunctions in defective or damaged CCTV cameras, utilizing troubleshooting techniques and diagnostic tools to identify root causes. Perform repairs, adjustments, and component replacements on faulty CCTV cameras to restore them to proper working condition, following manufacturer guidelines and best practices. Document all repair activities, including diagnoses, repair procedures, parts used, and test results, maintaining accurate records for quality control and warranty purposes. Collaborate closely with the production team, engineering department, and customer service representatives to address customer concerns, resolve technical issues, and improve product quality. Assist in the development and optimization of manufacturing processes, workflows, and procedures to enhance efficiency, productivity, and quality in CCTV camera production and repair operations. Adhere strictly to safety protocols, guidelines, and best practices to ensure a safe working environment for oneself and colleagues at all times. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; technical certification or associate degree in electronics, engineering, or a related field is preferred. Proven experience in electronic assembly, manufacturing, repair, or quality control, with a focus on CCTV cameras or similar electronic devices. Solid understanding of electronic components, circuitry, and assembly techniques, with the ability to interpret technical drawings, schematics, and product specifications. Proficiency in using various hand tools, power tools, soldering equipment, and electronic testing instruments for assembly, repair, and troubleshooting purposes. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues effectively and efficiently. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to communicate technical information clearly and effectively to colleagues and customers. Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment, with a proactive and self-motivated attitude towards work. Flexibility to work variable hours, including evenings, weekends, and overtime, as needed to meet production and repair deadlines.         Educational Qualification- Graduate Post-Graduate (ITI) DIPLOMA Experience required 1-6 Years  Job Type: Full-time Salary: Negotiable

column2: Job Description Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a Production Manager at Concepts Hygiene in Ahmedabad. The Production Manager will be responsible for managing production schedules and ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality products. They will also oversee safety protocols, manage inventory levels, and work with cross-functional teams to continually improve processes and drive results. Production Planning and Scheduling: Develop and implement production schedules to meet customer demand while optimizing resources and minimizing downtime. Coordinate with other departments such as sales, procurement, and logistics to ensure alignment of production plans with overall business objectives. Team Leadership and Management: Lead and manage a team of production supervisors, operators, and technicians. Provide guidance, coaching, and support to team members to foster a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Conduct regular performance evaluations and implement training and development plans as needed. Quality Assurance and Process Improvement: Establish and enforce quality control standards and procedures to ensure product quality meets or exceeds customer expectations. Implement process improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, reduce waste, and increase productivity. Analyze production data and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions. Resource Allocation and Optimization: Manage production resources including manpower, equipment, and materials to maximize efficiency and minimize costs. Coordinate with procurement and inventory management teams to ensure adequate supply of raw materials and components to support production requirements. Monitor equipment performance and maintenance schedules to minimize downtime and ensure optimal utilization. Health, Safety, and Compliance: Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and company policies to maintain a safe working environment. Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures to prevent accidents and injuries. Conduct regular safety inspections and audits to identify hazards and implement corrective actions.
