Manpower Resources India (P) Limited, a leading Executive Search company, offers services in Power, Steel, Infrastructure, Oil & Gas, Cement, Engineering space. We have been mandated by a leading Building Material Conglomerate for the below mentioned position .   Position title: Unit Head  Reporting to: Cluster Head Manufacturing Location: Multiple Locations Purpose of the role: This incumbent will be responsible for overseeing the entire operations of the grinding unit, ensuring efficient production, quality control, safety compliance, and effective management of resources. Key Responsibilities: Operational Leadership:  Provide strategic direction and leadership to achieve production targets while maintaining high standards of quality and safety.  Oversee the day-to-day operations of the grinding unit, including raw material handling, grinding process, and packaging.  Implement efficient production schedules, ensuring optimal utilization of resources and minimizing downtime. Lead improvement initiatives in      plant and long-term plant development Quality Assurance:  Ensure adherence to quality standards and specifications throughout the production process.  Implement quality control measures to identify and address any deviations or non-conformities.  Work closely with the Quality Assurance team to continuously improve product quality and consistency. Safety and Compliance:  Champion a culture of safety and compliance with all relevant regulations and company policies.  Conduct regular safety audits and risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential hazards.  Implement corrective actions to address safety concerns and promote a safe working environment. Ensure compliance to policy      mandates as applicable Cost Management:  Develop and manage the annual operating budget for the grinding unit, ensuring cost-effective operations.  Identify opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency improvements, driving initiatives to reduce operational expenses. Team Management and Development:  Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning.  Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback, and conduct performance evaluations.  Identify training needs and facilitate skill development initiatives for the team members. Ensure that right kind of      talent and skills is available for plant on management and shop floor      level. Stakeholder Management:  Build and maintain positive relationships with internal stakeholders, including senior management, other departments, and external partners.  Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to ensure alignment between production and market demand. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Production , Chemical, or Industrial Engineering; advanced degree preferred. Minimum of 20 years of experience in cement manufacturing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role within a grinding unit. Strong technical knowledge of cement grinding processes, equipment, and quality control systems. Proven track record of achieving production targets, driving process improvements, and managing operational budgets. Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a diverse team. Sound understanding of safety regulations, environmental standards, and compliance requirements in the cement industry. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions and influence stakeholders at all levels.

column2: POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Supervisor, Production Planning will be responsible for scheduling the production on the lines at the CM in close coordination with CM planners, Operations team and converting the production schedules into dispatch plan to provide the visibility of FG delivery to the supply chain team. The primary role of this position is to ensure production lines are efficiently scheduled to maximize production output, minimize down time, and reduce risk to the company's supply chain while meeting distributor needs. The position will be responsible for coordinating with Purchasing to manage the materials to keep the lines productive which includes accountabilities of financials controls, product obsolescence and excessive inventory. In addition, this position is responsible for building and enhancing systems, tools, and processes in support of a streamlined product flow that will reduce stocks-outs while also focusing on reducing excessive inventory (both finished goods and raw materials) in close coordination with Inventory manager.   DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: Responsible for building and enhancing systems, tools, and processes in support of a streamlined    product flow that will reduce stocks outs while also focusing on reducing excessive inventory, coordinate, expedite and track the flow of work and materials in the production department. Manage the Master Production Schedule to ensure maximum line efficiencies and output and reduce downtime from changeover or cleaning.  Capacity resource planning to convert demand plan into  master production and dispatch schedule based on input schedules, ETAs, for the coming month and share with Supply Chain for their deployment planning. Freezing capacities with the contract manufacturers based on material availability and prioritizing the production of SKUs based on FG inventory in the market and collaborate with GSS for material planning as per scheduled capacity and highlight any criticality in time. Close coordination with cross functional groups like SC, Sourcing teams by sharing the dispatch planning/scheduling based on material (RM/PM) arrival, planning of dispatch for ASCP (Advanced Supply chain planning). Ensure correct input to system (ASCP) in the form of OSP/work orders to align the material supplies by the procurement team.  Active participation in the pre-calls along with operations team and raise red flags, if any, pertaining to the FG delivery. Working towards dispatch compliance of the CM site against demand plan/production plan through tracking of dispatch volume on a daily/weekly and monthly frequency and ensuring the MIS is in use. Ensuring the close coordination among various cross functional team members for the changes or transitions as part of business requirement.  Work with internal teams and country management to establish optimal order quantities, inventory targets and turnover objectives. Ensure finished goods inventory coverage is within policy guidelines. Review aged inventory and help identify solutions for usage. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education:  Graduate having experience in production planning. Or MBA in Supply Chain Management with relevant experience. Certification in production planning and Inventory management systems.  Skills :- Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills  Solid mathematical skills and meticulous with details Highly analytical and effective problem solving skills  Ability to concurrently lead various high-level projects in a fast paced environment Strong computer and technical skill sets related to planning tools and analytical tools Leadership skills within a large company  Ability to interact with multiple departments in a multinational company  Ability to train and create the appropriate standard operating procedure for multiple departments within the Supply Chain Exceptional follow up skills and ability to meet all project deadlines Understanding of the various elements of Supply Chain Management (Production Planning and Inventory Control, Demand Management, Sourcing, Manufacturing, Packaging) Experience: Relevant experience of 4-7 years.  Experience in handling production planning and scheduling.  Understanding of the various elements of Supply Chain Management (Production Planning and Inventory Control, Demand Management, Sourcing, Manufacturing, Packaging) Having worked on Oracle/SAP or any other relevant ERP systems. FMCG, Nutraceutical, Pharmaceutical industry experience.

Key  Responsibilities:  1. Material Sourcing: - Identify and evaluate  potential suppliers based on quality, cost, and reliability. - Negotiate  contracts, pricing, and terms with suppliers to secure the best  possible deals. - Develop and maintain relationships with key suppliers  to ensure long-term partnerships. - Monitor market trends and identify  new sourcing opportunities to reduce costs and improve quality.  2.  Quality Control: - Implement and manage quality control processes to  ensure materials meet the required specifications. - Conduct regular  supplier audits to assess and improve their quality management systems. -  Collaborate with suppliers to resolve quality issues and implement  corrective actions. - Maintain documentation related to quality  inspections, certifications, and supplier performance.  3. Production  Planning: - Work closely with the production team to understand material   requirements and production schedules. - Ensure timely delivery of  materials to support uninterrupted production flow. - Optimize inventory  levels to balance cost efficiency and production needs. - Analyze  production data to identify bottlenecks and implement solutions to  improve efficiency.  4. Collaboration and Communication: - Coordinate  with internal departments, including production, quality, and logistics,  to ensure smooth operations. - Provide regular updates on sourcing  activities, material availability, and potential risks. - Prepare  reports and presentations for management to support decision-making  processes. column2: Role & responsibilit : Monitor inventory levels of raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished goods. Develop inventory control measures to minimize stock outs, excess inventory, and obsolescence.   Production Planning : Develop comprehensive production plans based on sales forecasts, customer orders, and inventory levels. Coordinate with sales, marketing, and procurement teams to ensure alignment of production schedules with demand projections. Resource Allocation : Determine resource requirements, including manpower, materials, and equipment, to meet production targets. Optimize resource utilization while minimizing costs and maximizing efficiency. Capacity Planning : Evaluate production capacity and identify opportunities for optimization. Implement strategies to increase capacity and improve production throughput while maintaining quality standards. Inventory Management : Monitor inventory levels of raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished goods. Develop inventory control measures to minimize stockouts, excess inventory, and obsolescence. Production Control : Implement production control mechanisms to monitor progress, identify bottlenecks, and take corrective actions as necessary. Ensure adherence to production schedules and quality standards to meet customer requirements. Continuous Improvement : Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance production processes, reduce lead times, and increase productivity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best practices and standardize procedures. Quality Assurance : Collaborate with the quality assurance team to ensure compliance with quality standards and regulatory requirements. Implement quality control measures to prevent defects and ensure product conformance. Performance Monitoring : Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure production performance and track progress against targets. Analyze production data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Reporting and Analysis : Prepare regular reports and presentations on production performance, including production output, efficiency, utilization rates, and variance analysis. Provide insights and recommendations to management for decision-making. Team Leadership : Provide leadership and guidance to the production planning and control team. Foster a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning within the team. Preferred candidate profile   The Production Planning Control Manager plays a pivotal role in overseeing and optimizing the production processes within the organization. They are responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring production plans to ensure efficient utilization of resources while meeting quality standards and delivery timelines. This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various departments to streamline operations and maximize productivity. Perks and benefits     Attractive perks & benefits will be there if you are passionate and want to be a part of fast-growing organisation.

Candidate will be M / F below 26 years   Postgraduates only in CHEMISTRY or BIOCHEMISTRY can apply. We will not accept PG in any other discipline.   Preference will be given to fresh graduates in chemistry / bio-chemistry / biotechnology /life-sciences (BZC) with good communication skills in English & Telugu. Knowledge of Hindi will be an asset. Exceptional students with over 8.0 in Intermediate (12th class) Science or with 1-2 years of experience can be considered as INTERN or Packing Assistant. JOB ROLE During 6 months training, the trainee will receive on the work training in all aspects of PRODUCTION & PACKING Departments. He / She will be also exposed to other pertinent work depending on skill set observed. The training period can be reduced or extended depending on ability to grasp and implement. The trainee will be engaged for the  on-the-job training in production,  packing departments for our fragrance related products. New product development will be a natural part of exposure during training.  Invitro Biotech Labs (www.lastingaroma.com)  manufactures fragrance related products like room fresheners, car air freshener danglers, restroom deodorizers, personal use perfumes, disinfectants, mosquito repellents & more.   Required Candidate profile  The candidate must understand, write and speak English.  Must follow spoken Hindi and Telugu . Proficiency in  MS Word & Excel  is a must. Candidate must be hard working, sincere with good grasping power and analytical abilities. The candidate must have handled basic lab equipment in graduation.  We are looking for flexible, job-needy candidates with desire to learn, develop & grow  Interested candidates can visit and peruse  our range of fragrance based products at www.lastingaroma.com Our company is located in Prasanth Nagar Industrial Area, Kukatpally Y Jn -  Hyderabad near Balanagar - metro station.  Candidates living relatively closer to our location will be preferred.    Perks and Benefits  During training period of 6 months, a  stipend of Rs.14,500 / month  will be offered. After successful completion of training period, the Trainee will be absorbed in regular rolls of company with industry matching package. There will ample opportunity for performers to pursue career growth. We reward deserving performers with out of turn increments & bonuses.  Please send your resume to Whatsapp + 91 9391383606 or invitbio@yahoo.com We will not entertain any phone call. Candidates who have applied earlier need not apply again.

column2: Role Overview: As the Store Manager for the Spare Part Division (SPD) at Oben Electric, you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of the spare parts warehouse, ensuring efficient inventory management, and providing exceptional customer service to both internal stakeholders and external customers. You will play a critical role in ensuring the availability of spare parts to support our electric motorcycle manufacturing and aftermarket service needs. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Health and wellness benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and growth. Collaborative and supportive work environment. Key Responsibilities: Oversee the operations of the spare parts store, including inventory management, order processing, and stock replenishment. Coordinate with the procurement team to ensure timely replenishment of spare parts inventory to meet production and aftermarket service requirements. Develop and implement efficient inventory control procedures to minimize stock discrepancies and optimize inventory levels. Ensure compliance with safety and quality standards in the storage and handling of spare parts. Collaborate with the sales and service teams to forecast spare parts demand and ensure adequate stock availability to meet customer needs. Maintain safety standards as per laws in the warehouse. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to spare parts inventory management and implement corrective actions as needed to achieve targets. Supervise store staff, including recruitment, training, and performance management. Maintain accurate records of inventory transactions, including receipts, issuances, and stock counts. Handle customer inquiries and complaints related to spare parts, providing timely resolution and ensuring customer satisfaction. Implement cost-saving initiatives and process improvements to optimize store operations and enhance efficiency. Knowhow & promoting of spare parts sales business through care centre. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. Knowledge of SAP & DMS is a must. Knowhow of export/spare part business will be prefered. Proven experience in store management, preferably in a spare parts or automotive industry. Strong understanding of inventory management principles and techniques. Excellent leadership and communication skills. Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in MS Office applications and inventory management software. Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping. Customer-focused mindset with a commitment to delivering exceptional service. Join Our Team: Join Oben Electric and be part of a dynamic team driving innovation and shaping the future of mobility. If you're an experienced marketing professional with a passion for electric vehicles and sustainable transportation, apply now to join us as Store Manager - SPD and make a significant impact on our journey towards Designing in India for the world!
column11: Order Management, Stock Replenishment, SAP, Inventory Management, Dealer Management System, Spare Parts

column2: You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of BOMs throughout the product lifecycle, from design to production, and collaborate with various departments including Engineering, Procurement, Production, and Quality Assurance, to manage changes, resolve discrepancies, and improve BOM-related processes. Responsibilities: BOM Creation and Maintenance: Develop and maintain accurate BOMs for all products, ensuring alignment with design specifications and manufacturing requirements. Review engineering drawings, specifications, and other documentation to extract relevant information for BOM creation. Regularly update BOMs to reflect design changes, component substitutions, and other revisions. Collaboration and Communication: Coordinate with Engineering, Procurement, Production, and other departments to gather necessary information for BOM creation and updates. Communicate changes and updates to stakeholders, ensuring clear understanding and implementation. Resolve discrepancies and conflicts in BOMs through collaboration with relevant teams. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline BOM management processes and enhance efficiency. Implement best practices and tools for BOM management, including software solutions where applicable. Continuously evaluate and improve BOM accuracy, completeness, and consistency. Quality Assurance: Ensure BOM accuracy and integrity to support quality control and compliance requirements. Collaborate with Quality Assurance teams to address BOM-related issues and improve quality standards. Participate in audits and assessments to verify BOM accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements. Supplier Collaboration: Work closely with Procurement to manage supplier relationships and ensure availability of components listed in BOMs. Communicate BOM requirements to suppliers and address any discrepancies or issues related to component procurement. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in BOM management or related roles within manufacturing or engineering environments. Strong understanding of product lifecycle management (PLM) processes and tools. Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills. Effective communication and collaboration abilities, with the capacity to work across diverse teams. Proficiency in BOM management software and Microsoft Office applications. Knowledge of regulatory requirements and quality standards relevant to BOM management. Preferred Qualifications: Certification in BOM management or related areas. Experience with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems for BOM management. Familiarity with Lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies.

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Project Planning and Scheduling    - Assist in the development of project plans, including defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.    - Create and manage detailed project schedules, timelines, and milestones.    - Coordinate and schedule project meetings, ensuring that all relevant team members and stakeholders are informed and prepared. 2. Documentation and Reporting    - Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, meeting minutes, and action items.    - Prepare and distribute regular project status reports to stakeholders, highlighting key milestones, risks, and issues.    - Ensure that all project documents are accurate, up-to-date, and accessible to the project team. 3. Communication and Coordination    - Facilitate effective communication within the project team and with external stakeholders.    - Act as the primary point of contact for project-related inquiries and communications.    - Organize and lead project meetings, including preparing agendas, documenting discussions, and tracking follow-up actions. 4. Task and Resource Management    - Assist in the assignment and tracking of project tasks, ensuring that team members are aware of their responsibilities and deadlines.    - Monitor the progress of project tasks and milestones, identifying and addressing any delays or issues.    - Coordinate the allocation of project resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials. 5. Risk and Issue Management    - Identify potential project risks and issues, and work with the project manager to develop mitigation strategies.    - Maintain a risk and issue log, tracking the status and resolution of each item.    - Escalate significant risks and issues to the project manager or appropriate stakeholders as needed. 6. Financial Management    - Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets, ensuring that expenditures are tracked and controlled.    - Prepare financial reports and updates for the project manager and stakeholders.    - Ensure that project expenses are properly documented and approved. 7. Quality Assurance    - Monitor project deliverables to ensure they meet quality standards and requirements.    - Assist in the implementation of quality control processes and procedures.    - Conduct regular reviews and assessments of project progress and performance. 8. Support to Project Manager    - Provide administrative and logistical support to the project manager as needed.    - Assist in the preparation of project proposals, presentations, and other documentation.    - Take on additional responsibilities and tasks as assigned by the project manager to support project objectives. Preferred candidate profile   - Bachelors & masters degree in project management, business administration, or a related field. - Proven experience in project coordination or a similar role. - Proficiency with project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project, ERP, PowerBi). - Strong organizational and multitasking skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team. - Familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) is a plus Perks and benefits   - Competitive salary and benefits package. - Opportunities for professional development and career growth. - A dynamic and supportive work environment.

column2: The Senior Systems Analyst (Engineering & Manufacturing) works closely with business teams to understand and analyze how core business processes leverage and interact with the PDM/PLM, CAD, and downstream manufacturing systems (i e, ERP, MES, MPS, etc) and identifies key opportunities for improvement     This role will act as a liaison between business units and technical teams by capturing business requirements, functional requirements, and ROIs related to process optimization and system integration projects     Works end-to-end with end-users, developers, and stakeholders to ensure quality assurance (QA) and timely delivery of IT projects     Coordinates and manages regular upgrades, enhancements, project deployments, and maintenance of the Engineering and Manufacturing systems to ensure stability, business continuity, and compliance with IT controls               Responsibilities/Objectives           Supports and aligns efforts to meet business needs     Manages relationships and expectations by communicating regularly with stakeholders on project status and results     Stays current with business needs and strategies; utilizes formal and informal written communication methods (i.e. emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists) to communicate updates and findings related to business processes and/or systems; facilitates project meetings and presentations to diverse audiences (i.e. senior management, end-users, technical staff)     Completes and regularly updates project documentation; manages project scope; adjusts project schedules when necessary; determines daily priorities; ensures efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; follows proper escalation paths; and manages relationships with stakeholders     Identifies, creates, and facilitates process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focuses on quality improvement and data management; ensures data is reliable, valid, and secure; develops process improvement plans; integrates new systems/processes with legacy systems/processes; and partners with business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions provided by IT align with long-term business strategies.     Provides and supports the implementation of technology-driven business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifies business needs; determines and carries out necessary processes and practices; monitors progress and results; recognizes and capitalizes on improvement opportunities; and adapts to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities     Provides project-level analysis and develops related diagrams, flows, tables, and/or graphs.     Collaborates closely with the Engineering and Manufacturing teams to implement solutions that align with business needs/requirements and support end-users and/or testers during the QA process.     Identifies business process improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)     Elicits and documents business and systems requirements (i.e., business requirements/stories, scope, use cases, diagrams)     Assesses PDM/PLM processes and related systems used by end-user groups and identify inefficiencies in system configuration, presentation, and overall UX (User Experience)     Demonstrates fluency in business processes and process differentiation     Understands and negotiates needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders     Creates and maintains issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates     Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions, and resolving conflicts.     Develops and executes test plans     Supports system conversions, upgrades, and enhancements.           Requirements           Must have experience working on multiple projects simultaneously while handling day-to-day intake of requests/issues/defects from the business     Strong project management skills; ability to successfully manage multiple tasks or competing priorities; strong relationship building skills & ability to negotiate     Bachelor s degree (IT or Computer Science focus preferred)     Engineering     5+ years of proven experience as a business/systems analyst and/or systems development capacity     5+ years of proven experience working with a professional PDM/PLM platform as a user, developer, analyst, or system administrator.     5+ years of CAD experience (ThingWorx, Creo, etc.)     10+ years in a technology-focused or process-improvement role     Basic understanding of relational database concepts and APIs     Proven analytical abilities     Exceptional interpersonal skills     Excellent written and verbal communication skills     Attention to detail
